questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters wants to send an email to website visitors who add items to their cart but fail to make a purchase. The email will include a list of products they added to their shopping cart.
✑ A sendable data extension contains the contact information and a session ID field for each subscriber who has abandoned their cart.
✑ A second data extension contains a corresponding session ID field and product data for each abandoned cart item, including product SKU, product name, quantity, price, and image URL.
Which feature should be used to display the list of products for each subscriber in this email?

discussion.content: Where are the rest of the questions 186-192? As of 11-Aug-2022 there should be 192 questions.

questions.question_text:
ABC Company wants to automate the sending of shipping notices and a customer survey.
- Shipping notices will be sent once a day.
- The shipping file will be placed on the FTP some time after 4:00 p.m.
- The shipping data will be sorted in the Shipping Notice data extension.
- A field in the data extension will contain the shipping date.
- The survey needs to be sent at 9:00 a.m., exactly 10 days after the customer's order ships.
Which workflow would most effectively enable ABC Company to do this?
A.
//IMG//

B.
//IMG//

C.
//IMG//

D.
//IMG//

discussion.content:
D is not applicable since
'When an automation is in the middle of a wait activity when the next scheduled or triggered run occurs, that run is skipped.'
(https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_as_wait_activity.htm&type=5) so the answer is C

D

the automation will be scheduled to run daily and as soon as the file drops the automation imports and filter contacts to send email secondly it will wait to send another email at 9:00 AM it will filter again on the basis of "ship date" and send email for the day.

D 

the automation will be scheduled to run daily and as soon as the file drops the automation imports and filter contacts to send email secondly it will wait to send another email at 9:00 AM it will filter again on the basis of "ship date" and send email for the day.

Answer is C. 

A - Scheduled is not correct because we cannot guarantee that the file is uploaded by 7pm
B,D - Automation Studio will skip all runs for the next 10 days while in the wait period. This needs two automations to achieve (or use Journey Builder)
I think D does work? You can create a wait to send at exactly 9am.
Why not D? "wants to automate the sending of shipping notices AND a customer survey." Is the trick question in the semantics of "wiil be" and "needs to be"? Is that why C should be the answer?

comments.content:
I think C>D because "he survey needs to be sent at 9:00 a.m., exactly 10 days after the customer's order ships." 
The scheduled second automation allows us to guarantee the time vs in C were relying on a trigger to run the automation which wouldn't be reliable for exact timing

questions.question_text:
A customer provides a file containing only new and updated subscriber records exported from its marketing database.
✑ The file will be uploaded to the customer's Enhanced FTP automatically at 3 a.m. daily.
✑ The customer requires that the import completes prior to 4 a.m.
✑ On average, the file will contain about two million rows of data each day.
Based on the customer's requirements and recommended best practices, how should the daily file be imported?

choices.B: Import the file into a list, using the 'add and update' method.
choices.A: Import the file into a list, using the 'update only' method.
choices.C: Import the file into a data extension, using the 'add and update' method.
choices.D: Import the file into a data extension, using the 'overwrite' method.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is the correct one

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C. With overwrite existing contacts will be deleted.
You can't use overwrite. Existing users that haven't been updated wouldn't be added

comments.content: Typo< should be You can't use overwrite - 'a file containing only new and updated subscriber records'

discussion.content: You can use overwrite - 'a file containing only new and updated subscriber records'

choices.C: Use an import activity to import a file from the SFTP
choices.A: Use a query activity to populate the auto-suppression
choices.D: Use the Import Wizard in Automation Studio

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters' marketing team is new to Marketing Cloud and has very little coding experience. They have employed a consultant to help them design an automated solution for maintaining an auto-suppression list.

Which solution should the consultant recommend?

choices.A: Report is saved in Standard Salesforce folder.
choices.C: Required profile attributes are properly mapped.
choices.B: Email Address column is included in the report used for sending.
choices.D: Sendable data extension is saved in the Salesforce Data Extensions folder.

questions.question_text:
After implementing Marketing Cloud Connect, the customer notices tracking details from Email Studio initiated sends are not being sent back to Sales Cloud.

Which configuration in Marketing Cloud should the customer verify?

discussion.content: Where else data extension can be saved if not in data extension folder? I think mapping is more important. Should be C.
